After you've had some tea, carry on practising.
tr: Çayını içtikten sonra çalışmaya devam et.

en: Come and have tea with me.
Let's talk over a cup of tea, shall we?
How about making me a cup of tea?
Please bring a cup of tea to me.
tr: Bana bir çay getirir misin, lütfen?

en: He refreshed himself with a cup of tea.
Will you have a cup of tea?
Please give me a cup of tea.
I'd like a cup of tea.
Would you like to have a cup of tea?
Will you have some more tea?
Won't you have some more tea?
Give me some more tea.
Would you like some more tea?
Would you like another cup of tea?
Would you care for another cup of tea?
Would you like a cup of tea?
Won't you have some tea?
Tea was introduced from China.
Would you like tea or coffee?
Fifty persons can be accommodated for tea.
If you put more tea leaves into the pot, the tea will taste better.
tr: Çaydanlığa daha çok çay koyarsan, çay daha lezzetli olur.

en: The tea tree is a kind of camellia.
Please clear away the tea things.
The quality of tea is going down.
Which do you prefer, tea or coffee?
tr: Çay mı, kahve mi tercih edersin?

en: Which would you rather have, tea or coffee?
tr: Hangisini içersin, çay mı kahve mi?

en: Which do you like better, tea or coffee?
tr: Hangisini daha çok seversin, çayı mı kahveyi mi?

en: Tea and coffee helps to start the day.
tr: Çay ve kahve güne başlamaya yardımcı olur.

en: The tea is too strong. Add some water.
tr: Çay çok demli. Biraz su ekle.

en: We've run out of tea.
I'd like a tea.
I'm ashamed to say that it's true.
I'm glad to meet you.
Do you know each other?
Please let us know.
I hope your birthday is full of song and good times all day long! Happy birthday!
tr: Doğum günün tüm gün şarkılarla ve eğlencelerle dolu geçsin! İyi ki doğdun!

en: Happy birthday to you!
May I escort you home?
Just observe your cat and you will get to know him.
How late are you open?
Your garden needs some attention.
How do you heat the house?
I suggest that your son come to our party.
Your dog is very big.
How is it going with your family?
What kinds of goods do you sell in your shop?
Your children look healthy.
Let me take you home.
I am surprised that your family has a Japanese car.
Do you let your children drink coffee?
A burglar broke into your house while you were away on vacation.
Please feel free to have a second helping.
Don't talk about it in my mother's presence.
Would you like to wait?
Please hang on. I'll put him on the phone.
tr: Bekleyin lütfen, hemen onu telefona bağlıyorum.

en: You'll have to wait.
Thank you for your patience.
I'm sorry to have kept you waiting.
Take care of yourself.
Did you get the package I sent you?
At the funeral, the widow looked very dignified, with her black suit, hat and gloves.
tr: Cenazede dul kadın, siyah takımı, şapkası ve eldivenleriyle çok vakur görünüyordu.

en: Will I do as your partner?
We look forward to your early reply.
You may use my bicycle such as it is.
My car, such as it is, is at your disposal.
You shall be my daughter's husband.
I don't mean to make you worry.
I will sue you.
Guys, what are you talking about? Are you gonna steal my date!?
tr: Arkadaşlar, ne konuşuyorsunuz? Randevumu mu kapmaya çalışıyorsunuz!?

en: I think you'll like it too.
You're really a number-one fool.
You had better take this medicine if you want to get well.
tr: İyileşmek istiyorsanız bu ilacı alsanız iyi olur.

en: You are lying to me.
You wouldn't be so casual about it if you were directly involved.
tr: Doğrudan işin içinde olsaydınız, bu kadar rahat davranmazdınız.

en: It will take a long time to live down your disgrace.
tr: Bu utancınızı unutturmanız uzun zaman alacak.

en: You trust people too much.
You have only to sweep the floor.
He told me point-blank that I was fired.
Have you made up your mind to become a teacher?
You have a habit of exaggerating everything.
I brought you up under my personal care.
You are old enough to take care of yourself.
You've taken everything.
You always try to blame somebody else.
You are a goody-goody.
You did it all right.
Don't scatter your things about.
I sure rubbed your nose in shit.
Your beauty turns me pale.
He looks like your brother.
Leave it alone!
This is your responsibility. It's not the kind of thing you can laugh off.
She sets your world alight.
You are soul needs rescue.
Your soul has been condemned to hell.
Your soul needs rescue.
Your behavior brought disgrace on our family.
Your heart's beating, alive and beating.
You have caused me to lose my temper.
This is your fault.
You are two-faced.
I can wait for you.
I will make a new suit for you.
tr: Sana yeni bir takım elbise dikeceğim.

en: I'm quite out of patience with you.
You shall have my car.
I'm counting on you.
I'm no match for you.
Can't you hear the sound?
I know you don't care.
I've got no time to sit and talk.
I know you can make it better.
I know you can make it.
Where were you loafing?
It seems you and I are essential to this project. We'd better get along or it'll go badly.
tr: Görünüşe göre bu proje için sen ve ben şartız. İyi geçinsek iyi olur yoksa işler kötü gider.

en: You noisy children will be chucked off by the driver.
tr: Şoför sizi gürültücü çocuklar, aşağı atar.

en: I saw the picture you took of that fish.
You just made me miss the perfect shot when you hollered.
If you act like a child, you will be treated as such.
tr: Çocuk gibi davranırsan, çocuk gibi muamele görürsün.

en: That's my own affair.
You are wrong.
There's no need for you to butt in. Just let him do this on his own.
tr: Senin karışmana gerek yok. Bırak kendi başına yapsın.

en: You talk so fast I can't understand a word you say.
tr: O kadar hızlı konuşuyorsun ki tek kelime anlamıyorum.

en: You are drunk!
You're overworked.
You should go ahead and do it, just like you said you would.
You should have seen yourself, yawning all through the meeting.
Good-bye!
You're out of it.
It's in the overhead compartment.
We'll call you when your table is ready.
What are you planning to do for the New Year vacation?
I am greatly indebted to you for all you have done for me.
tr: Benim için yaptıkların için sana çok minnettarım.

en: I really appreciate your kindness.
It has always been a pleasure to work with you.
tr: Seninle çalışmak her zaman bir zevk olmuştur.

en: There is nothing to be gained by flattery.
Complimenting is lying.
Beware of smooth talk.
Could you bring me some water?
Can I have some water, please?
Could I get some water, please?
May I have a glass of water?
Just water, please.
The rights you requested do not belong to us.
tr: Talep ettiğiniz haklar bize ait değil.

en: May I have the honor of asking you?
I'd like a doll, a new bicycle.....and peace on earth!
tr: Bir oyuncak bebek, yeni bir bisiklet.....ve dünya barışı istiyorum!

en: No gratuity accepted.
Thank you again for your good thoughts.
tr: İyi düşünceleriniz için tekrar teşekkür ederim.

en: Thanks so much for your good thoughts.
I'm very grateful for your sympathy.
This way, please, mademoiselle.
What's your daughter's name?
Your daughter passed the examination, I hear.
I ask to see your daughter.
Would you like a ride?
It was kind of you to invite us.
Thank you very much for your invitation.
What size do you wear?
This accident has nothing to do with me, officer.
tr: Bu kazanın benimle hiçbir ilgisi yok, memur bey.

en: Here comes a copper!
I am pleased at your coming.
Let's have sushi.
You can't drive. You've been drinking.
It was gracious of you to accept.
Can I drink alcohol?
Let's have sake.
As he was drinking he got very merry and kept telling everybody just how much he hated hospitals.
tr: İçtikçe neşelendi ve herkese hastanelerden ne kadar nefret ettiğini anlatıp durdu.

en: No drinkers.
Liquor will have an effect on a person.
The minute I have something to drink, I turn bright red.
Do you drink alcohol?
Everybody has their favorite drink.
Drinking too much is bad for the health.
I can't help you. As a matter of fact, I'm very busy just now.
tr: Size yardım edemem. Açıkçası, şu an çok meşgulüm.

en: Shall I help you?
I am willing to help you.
I said, "Is there anything I can do?"
tr: Yapabileceğim bir şey var mı, diye sordum.

en: I asked you if you wanted some help.
Let me help you.
The maid was dead tired of her household chores.
The maid immediately cleaned the dishes from the table.
The servants tried to carry out their master's order.
tr: Hizmetçiler efendilerinin emrini yerine getirmeye çalıştılar.

en: The maid made my bed.
It's very decent of you to help me.
I'd be very grateful if you'd help me.
tr: Bana yardım edebilirseniz çok minnettar olurum.

en: Could you help me?
It's very kind of you to help me.
Thank you for your assistance.
May I use the bathroom?
Could you show me where the bathroom is?
